article.description:
Marcus Melvin scored a career-high 23
points and North Carolina State's defense forced 20 turnovers in
beating Northwestern 74-49 in the ACC-Big Ten Challenge on
Wednesday night.
article.headline: Melvin scores career-high 23 points for Wolfpack
article.linkText: Tough defense leads N.C. State to rout of Northwestern
article.story:
RALEIGH, N.C. (AP) -- Marcus Melvin scored a career-high 23
points and North Carolina State's defense forced 20 turnovers in
beating Northwestern 74-49 in the ACC-Big Ten Challenge on
Wednesday night.

	   Melvin was 7-for-9 from the field and 5-for-5 from the foul line
on a near-perfect night. The 6-foot-8 junior forward also tied a
career high with four 3-pointers as the Wolfpack improved to 3-0.

	   Julius Hodge added 17 points as N.C. State shot 51 percent.

	   An ice storm held the crowd to 3,833 in the 19,722-seat RBC
Center, but those who came saw N.C. State play its best game to
date.

	   The Wildcats (3-2) averaged 12 turnovers in their first four
games, but had that many with 15:24 remaining as their offense
bogged down under the Wolfpack's pressure defense.

	   At one stretch early in the second half, Northwestern coughed it
up on seven straight possessions as a disgusted Bill Carmody sat on
the bench with head in hands.

	   Carmody's team couldn't even call a time out when he wanted one,
ignoring the coach during a more than six-minute scoring drought.
When he finally got a stoppage, N.C. State led 53-28 at Melvin
closed a 10-0 run with a slam dunk and a 3-pointer.

	   Two free throws by Melvin with 8:27 remaining gave N.C. State a
30-point cushion.

	   Aaron Jennings led the Wildcats with 17 points.

	   N.C. State made its first five 3-pointers with Melvin hitting
three in the opening 4:10 and Scooter Sherrill adding a pair as the
Wolfpack took an early double-digit lead.

	   The Wildcats closed to 24-21, but went cold from the field over
the final six minutes of the half to fall into a 14-point hole.

	   N.C. State got points from five different players in its 11-0
run, including three free throws by Melvin, who had 12 first-half
points.

	   The Wolfpack defense was also key in the opening 20 minutes,
forcing 11 Northwestern turnovers.

	   Northwestern committed just seven fouls in the first half, but
three came from Jimmy Maley, who had 15 points in his collegiate
debut last week at Kansas State. After hitting both of his
3-pointers out of the gate in this one, Maley had to sit out the
final 7:50 of the period.

	   Melvin's previous best was 20 points in December 2001 against
Wofford.
